intro: Nortenia thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in cymes, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
